page.title: 18Manifold Valley Bygones Club
page.content: There is an active group in the area for people interested in vintage machinery, called The Manifold Valley Bygones Group. The group used to meet at the Greyhound pub in Warslow but, due to an increase in the membership, the group now meet at The Countryman in Newtown. At the meetings, on the last Thursday of every month, members discuss rallies and their engines, and have slide shows. Most members own stationary engines like Listers, Petters and Wolseleys. These engines are used to drive old farm machinery like pumps, sharpeners and saws, or to generate electricity. Other members own old cars, tractors, motorbikes and ploughs. The group organises rallies themselves and members attend other local rallies with their machines.
